page.title: 03Wildlife
page.content: This area has an abundance of wildlife -flora and fauna are found everywhere. The woods are deciduous and coniferous .The deciduous woods support an amazing variety of birds, among them many migratory species such as redstarts, fieldfares, redwings, whinchats and pied flycatchers to name but a few.They also provide homes for the squirrels badgers, foxes, deer, rabbits and snakes.Throughout the year there is a changing pattern of colour provided by the flowers and fruits of each season -aconites ,wood sorrel,bluebells,foxgloves,rosebay willow herb,nuts and holly berries.When wooded areas are felled nature takes over and the scars are soon covered.In the streams there are fish to be found -trout,eels and pike.
